author: Chris Cumming
title: Cumming’s Take: U.S. Deal-Review Panel Cites Risks in Private-Equity Model
text:
Last week, criticism of the private-equity model came from an unexpected quarter: A panel headed by former Goldman Sachs Group Inc. executive, hedge-fund manager and “foreclosure king” Steven Mnuchin, now secretary of the Treasury.
Mr. Mnuchin oversees the Committee on Foreign Investment in the U.S., or CFIUS, a panel that reviews mergers in which a foreign company or person could gain control of an American business. If CFIUS thinks a deal potentially could damage national security, it sends its verdict to the president,...
